P3 Changes

Håvard, Petter, Runar, Thomas

13.11.2016

Link to start of page: https://build-a-pc.github.io

List of changes

  • [2016.10.28] Changed logo. That Runar made
  • [2016.10.28] Search function moved down to footer, where we indeed to have site description in colum 1 of 2 of the footer.
  • [2016.10.31] The highlighting feature was dropped, because its use was limited and it required very little JavaScript coding. Runar, which was assigned to this task, will instead implement the quiz validation feature which originally was assigned to Petter.
  • [2016.11.01] Quiz have been moved to its own page on every section.
  • [2016.11.02] The "beginner/expert mode" feature was dropped, because no potential uses were clear. This task was assigned to Thomas. As of now, each member has one feature to work on or previously worked on.
  • [2016.11.02] Petter is not entirely finished with the search feature, and has been granted another week to finish it. Thomas is not finished with the dynamic breadcrumbs feature, and has also been granted another week to finish it.
  • [2016.11.02] Since the distribution of content writing was not mentioned in the product specification, it will be specified here. Petter will write the "Parts" section. Runar will write the "Part Vendors" section, and possibly help with the "Windows" page in the "Operating Systems" section. Thomas will write most of the "Operating Systems" section. Håvard will write the "Assembling the PC" section. The deadline for this is early November 13th.
  • [2016.11.13] Site description is now moved to the central part of the page.
  • [2016.11.13] No social icons.
  • [2016.11.13] Removed information about ourself from the home page.
  • [2016.11.13] Mac OS X dropped because this only applied to MACs and isn’t something you can install on every PC.

Logical Navigation Structure Changes

Added a Quiz page on the end of every section. That contain the indented quiz.

Every section has a page linked with it (vendors don't have this because it does not have any child pages), that have a little description and a navigation structure map on it.

The navigation structure is now.

  • Home
  • Parts (section)
    • Parts (Page with description)
    • Motherboard and CPU
    • RAM and GPU
    • Storage, network card, sound card
    • Cooling, PSU, case
    • Accessories
    • Quiz
  • Part vendors (section and single page)
    • Quiz
  • Operating Systems (section)
    • Operating Systems (Page with description)
    • Windows
    • Linux
    • Macintosh
    • Quiz
  • Assembling the PC (section)
    • Assembling the PC (Page with description)
    • Hardware
    • Software
    • Quiz

File Navigation Structure Changes

In images/ added a folder for assembly and vendors that contains images for the section.

In pages/ added folders for every section that contains their subpages.

On root added a file "content.txt" containing name of every section and page for the search function to use. The search function search every page mentioned in this file.

File navigation structure is now.

  • documents/: Contains a standalone/independent site (sub-site) for project documents.
    • images/: Contains images.
    • mockups/: Contains mockups of the site.
    • style/: Contains styles.
    • index.html: Sub-site index with links to all project documents.
    • p1_requirements.html: P1 Project Requirements document.
    • p2_design.html: P2 Project Design document.
    • p3_changes.html: P3 Changes document.
    • p4_testing.html: P4 Testing document.
    • px_template.html: Template for new project documents.
  • favicon/: Contains favicon and related images and configurations.
  • images/: Contains all images.
    • logo/: Contains site logos in different sizes.
    • parts/: Contains PC part images.
    • assembly/: Contains assembly images.
    • vendors/: Contains vendors logo images.
    • background.gif
    • loading.png
  • pages/: Contains all pages other than home (which is in index.html). These files will be loaded into index.html and replace home live via AJAX.
    • assembly/: Contains assembly subpages.
    • error/: Contains error subpages.
    • oss/: Contains oss(Operating Systems) subpages.
    • parts/: Contains parts subpages.
    • vendors/: Contains vendors subpages.
    • home.inc.html: The home page.
    • sitemap.inc.html: The sitemap page.
    • template.inc.html: A template page.
  • scripts/: Contains all JavaScript scripts.
  • style/: Contains all styles.
    • normalize.css: CSS normalizer/reset.
    • site.css: Styles for entire site (not sub-site).
  • content.txt: Txt file with everypage written in it.
  • index.html: Site index, contains home page and will load other pages via AJAX.

Minimum Requirements

Everyone fulfilled their minimum requirements. Created 1 JavaScript each, and made the content for their assigned section.

Håvard must be given a medal for his work on the visuals of the page, where he created everything you see on the page from background, banner, footer, fonts. He basically created a template for us other to use. And his amazing work with implementing AJAX and the navigation bar. His AJAX code means that we can load only the parts of the webpage that changs not the entire page, this means all layout is in index.html the content loads from the respecting html files. Runar must be given the credits for the creation of the logo.

We are using external CSS files for styling, the same with JavaScript. They can be found in style/ and script/ folders in the project. When we are using external files like this we dont have to create a file for every page we create.

The Javascript files is going to be compined into 1 file, without unnecessary whitespace.

List of which JavaScript each person made. Deadline for JavaScript 1.11

  • Petter made the search function for the site. Was finished 1.11 but did bug fixing until 11.11.
  • Håvard made the AJAX function and also the javascript for the navigation bar. Finished before 1.11, including bugs.
  • Runar made the validation function for the quizzes. Finished 1.11 with the quiz function, but had to wait on the quizzes before testing it with the function.
  • Thomas made the breadcrumbs function for the site. Delivered the function on 11.11, and fixed some bugs on 13.11.

List of what content each person made. Deadline early 13.11.

  • Petter made the content for the section Parts.
  • Håvard made the content for the section Assembling a PC.
  • Runar made the content for the section Vendors and also the Windows subpage in the section Operating Systems.
  • As of 13.13 22:00 Thomas has not made the contents for Linux, Runar has taken over this work.
